fingerprint.description: Valid GPG fingerprint length (128-bit v3, 160-bit v4, or 256-bit v6), uppercased

label.description: The label or name associated with the individual or entity, typically matching the name on the GPG key.

type.description: The type of source: 'url' for a web URL, 'cache' for a local copy of the public key.

uri.description: The URI of the source, which can be a URL or a copy of the PGP key block with newline characters escaped (see also bin/keyblock-oneline.sh).

sources.description: A list of sources providing the key or related information, which can be a URL or a copy of key data with newline characters escaped (see also bin/keyblock-oneline.sh).

date.description: The date when the verification or cross-signing took place, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

comment.description: A brief description of what the reference verifies or supports (e.g., project affiliation, key ownership).

artifact.description: A cryptographic artifact (i.e. clearsigned message) demonstrating possession of a specific key (i.e. signing subkey)

oneOf.description: A URL pointing to an authoritative source or resource that validates the reference.

items.description: A list of related URLs pointing to authoritative sources or resources that validate the reference.

oneOf.description: A URL (or an array of related URLs) pointing to authoritative sources or resources that validate the reference.

dns.description: Valid DNS domain name consisting of one or more labels (separated by dots), with each label containing only letters, numbers, and hyphens, and no label being longer than 63 characters. Provided for OPENPGPKEY DNS resource records (https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-dane-openpgpkey-06#section-2).

type.description: The type of verification indicated by the evidence provided: project affiliation (role), self-attestation (user), private key use (key), certified by another key holder (sig1, sig2, sig3), certified by a Credential Service Provider (CSP)

refs.description: A list of references that provide evidence to support the identity assertion. Each reference must include a date, comment, and type.

items.description: A list of tags or labels that categorize or identify the individual or entity (e.g., 'OWASP', 'developer').

tags.description: Tags associated with the identity, which help categorize or identify the individual or entity.
